channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15558] fix char whitespace handling for vectorization
item.summary: fix char whitespace handling for vectorization

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Actually, I was able to repro locally... looks like there are a bunch of old out files for q files that no longer exist that I was trying to run.
mmccline can you take a look? Some other out files might need updated, we'll see what fails.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:

mmccline can you look at the updates to the schema evolution files? It looks like all the places where row width increased, but results didn't, are when we are converting from char to something else. In some places with char, results have changed

Ok, for the changes in schema_evol_text_vec_table.q

The test for table_change_string_group_string_group_string takes input STRING columns and converts to CHAR / VARCHAR.

For example, for insert_num 102, the STRINGs are "ox". The changed output shows more CHAR fields being padded out. Comparing schema_evol_text_vec_table.q.out to schema_evol_text_nonvec_table.q.out shows no real differences.

Same for schema_evol_text_vecrow_table.q.out

However, it has me wonder if there are other places where this is broken in vectorization.
Committed to master. Thanks for the review!
